content.description: Grab the nice jug at head height and pull to the lip. Traverse up and right until you can mantle easily onto the top.
content.location: Only 50 feet or so down hill from the stone wall. This boulder is hard to see because the tall side faces downhill.

content.description: Sit start the diagonaling rail. Bump right and pull to the lip. Mantle onto the top.
content.location: A short boulder on the north side of the stone wall. Look for a distinctive diagonaling slash across a slight overhang.

content.description: If only it was longer! Climb the obvious discontinuous flake system to the top of the boulder.
content.location: On the Crystal Boulder. Look for the obvious flake crack.

content.description: Sit start the two aretes on the slight overhang. Bump your way up good arete holds to the top.
content.location: On this Crystal Boulder. This boulder sits alongside the stone wall (the only one to do so). There is a slight overhang on one end.

content.description: Ouch! This crystal-studded rock is as rough as it gets! Sit start the low flake/jug. Pull up into crystally edges then mantle onto the top.
content.location: Across the gully from Tree Hugger.

content.description: Sit start the shallow right hand pocket. Pull to the lip and mantle onto the slab above.
content.location: On the uphill side of the boulder.

content.description: Eight small boulders located on the northeast flank of Rock Rimmon Hill. The boulders are fairly short and most only offer one or two climbs per boulder. The forest here is open and sunny making it a pleasant place to climbs during the spring and fall.
